TopicTitle: hello to the world of kerbal space! today the game begins

Articles.Content:
hi there, recently new to the game, been playing on and off for 2 months, ive mastered circular orbits, basic rocket construction and just starting to get the hang of kerbal orbit based rendevouz, not including docking however this morning i did successfully complete my first ever rendevouz and DOCKING and completed my first major milestone towards the future UKASS-01 or united kerbal alliance space station.. from the future master of the kerbalverse-HAXSIS image is of my basic barely passable docked craft

Edited December 12, 2014 by Haxsis
didnt load image properly

Welcome to the forums.

RV and Dock can be very stressful for some but you've done it in 2 months but in that time you say you barely played so well done.
hey, welcome and congrats on docking, its no walk in the park.
Nice! With docking, travel to other bodies is a lot easier. If not already, try to go o the Mun! It's a fun place to start your interplanetary adventures at.
Welcome to the forums. They will slowly consume all your time, money, and life force...then when you think you haven't got anything to lose...Comcast will randomly shut off the internet.

i want to learn everything i need to kerbin side of things then start sending stuff to other planets, that way it wnt be a problem for me to intiate my grand plan for kerbin, a giant space station with interior docks, fuel resupply, rcs resupply, life boats,construction area designated to long range rockets, deployment zones for science vessels and a docking zone filled with major parts for construction, if i forget to tow something up to orbit, plus it will have to look all form finish too, so none of this oddly pointing modules everywhere. the goal is to make an easy all in 1 port for colonising the entire system
